intro: Sinocarum meeboldioides, commonly known as the Chinese starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, star-shaped fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value and unique fruit, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
